thread.title: RELIGION NOTES: Church to bless animals, more
thread.title_full: RELIGION NOTES: Church to bless animals, more - Press Enterprise

author: The Press-Enterprise
title: RELIGION NOTES: Church to bless animals, more
text:
Published: Oct. 9, 2015 Updated: 1:11 p.m. Church to hold Blessing of the Animals SUN CITY – Menifee United Church of Christ will conduct a Blessing of the Animals at its 10 a.m. worship service on Sunday, Oct. 11. All people and animals are welcome and the Rev. Bill Freeman will bless stuffed animals for children who don’t have pets.
Menifee United Church of Christ is at 26701 McCall Blvd., Sun City.
Information: 951-679-1149
– Staff report
Church to present free concert ROMOLAND – John Paul Jackson, a musician and singer as well as a cancer survivor, will give a repeat performance at Romoland Assembly of God Church on Oct. 18. The concert will take place during the morning service at 10:45 a.m.
The church is at 27864 Monroe Ave., Romoland.
Information: 951-928-1918
– Staff report
Senior event planned HOMELAND – Community First Church of God - Hemet will host the Senior Adult Fellowship Enrichment Rally at 10 a.m. Tuesday, Oct. 13. The theme is the Power of Senior Outreach and Prayerful Interaction.
The event will include praise, worship, choir music, soloists, instrumentalists, public and private vendors, government exhibits and lunch. The keynote speaker is Pastor David Winn, executive director of the Association of the Church of God, Southern California and Nevada.
The church is at 31371 Highway 74, Homeland.
Information: 951-926-1345
– Staff report
Send items for possible inclusion in Religion Notes to community@pe.com.
